Reason: The DESTINATION_TYPE configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly affects the type of destination file to be created during the conversion process, which can have a significant impact on the final output of the conversion. This configuration involves performance-related operations that are time-expensive and memory-expensive within its related code, leading to notable performance variations at the system level.
